abstract.para: The topic covers switching of modes using the setenforce command and by changing the permanent configuration.

topic.para: You can switch the &selnx; mode temporarily or permanently.

section.title: Changing the &selnx; mode temporarily
section.para: To set &selnx; to the permissive or enforcing mode temporarily, use the command setenforce.

where MODE_ID is 0 for the permissive mode or 1 for the enforcing mode.
Remember that you cannot disable &selnx; using the setenforce command.

section.title: Changing the &selnx; mode permanently
section.para: To perform changes to the &selnx; mode that persists rebooting of the system, edit the /etc/selinux/config configuration file. If &selnx; is possibly causing issues to your system, switch to the permissive mode and debug your system.
